intro: Godetia rubicunda, commonly known as the redflower godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Godetia rubicunda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant floral display.
